meanings.definition: A person who declaims loudly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The declaimers in the play projected their voices to the back of the theater.
meanings.sent2: The group of declaimers gathered in the park to practice their speeches.
meanings.sent3: The declaimers at the town hall meeting were so passionate, they almost seemed like actors.
meanings.sent4: Her father was known as the declaimer of the family, always making his opinions heard.
meanings.sent5: The declaimers in the courtroom made sure their arguments were heard by all.

meanings.definition: Those who speak or recite in a dramatic or theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: During the school play, the declaimers delivered their lines with great emotion.
meanings.sent2: The declaimers at the poetry reading captivated the audience with their powerful delivery.
meanings.sent3: The declaimers at the party turned a simple story into an entertaining performance.
meanings.sent4: The declaimers on the street corner attracted a crowd with their animated storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The declaimers in the movie brought the characters to life with their expressive dialogue.
